description.full:
This file is part of
 ZUIX, Javascript library for component-based development.
       https://genielabs.github.io/zuix
description.summary:
This file is part of
 ZUIX, Javascript library for component-based development.
       https://genielabs.github.io/zuix

code:
this._fieldCache = [];

// Interface methods
this.init = null;
this.create = null;
this.destroy = null;
this._childNodes = [];

tags.string:
**Example - View's HTML** ```html

...

...

``` **Example - JavaScript** ```js cp.field('title') .html('Hello World!'); var desc = cp.field('description'); desc.html('The spectacle before us was indeed sublime.'); ```
{!string} fieldName Value to match in the `data-ui-field` attribute.
tags.name: fieldName
tags.description: Value to match in the `data-ui-field` attribute.

tags.string: {ZxQuery} A `{ZxQuery}` object wrapping the matching element.
tags.description: A `{ZxQuery}` object wrapping the matching element.

description.full:
Gets elements in the component's view with `data-ui-field`
matching the given `fieldName`.
description.summary:
Gets elements in the component's view with `data-ui-field`
matching the given `fieldName`.

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

// get all `checkbox` elements with `.checked` class.
var choices = cp.view('input[type="checkbox"].checked');
choices.removeClass('.checked');
// hide the component's view
cp.view().hide();

description.full:
Gets the component's view or the view elements matching
the given `filter` in which case acts as a shorthand for
`cp.view().find(filter)`.
description.summary:
Gets the component's view or the view elements matching
the given `filter` in which case acts as a shorthand for
`cp.view().find(filter)`.

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

var m = {
     title: 'Thoughts',
     message: 'She stared through the window at the stars.'
 };
cp.model(m);
cp.model().title = 'Changes';
console.log(cp.model().title);

Example - JavaScript 

// somewhere inside the slide-show component controller
cp.trigger('slide:change', slideIndex);

// somewhere in a page hosting the slide-show component
// set component's event listeners
zuix.context('my-slide-show')
  .on('slide:change', function(slideIndex) { ... })
  .on(...);

description.full:
Triggers the component event `eventPath` with the given
`eventData` object. To listen to a component event use the
`{ComponentContext}.on(eventPath, handler)` method or
in case `isHook` is set to true, use the
`zuix.hook(eventPath, handler)` method.
description.summary:
Triggers the component event `eventPath` with the given
`eventData` object. To listen to a component event use the
`{ComponentContext}.on(eventPath, handler)` method or
in case `isHook` is set to true, use the
`zuix.hook(eventPath, handler)` method.

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

// somewhere in the `create` method of the {ContextController}
zuix.controller(function(cp){
  cp.create = function() {
    // ....
    cp.expose('setSlide', slide);
  }
  // ...
  function slide(slideIndex) { ... }
  // ...
});
// ...
// calling the exposed method from the instance of
// the component.
var ctx = zuix.context('my-slide-show');
ctx.setSlide(2);
{string} methodName Name of the exposed function.
tags.name: methodName

tags.string: {function} handler Reference to the controller member to expose.
tags.name: handler
tags.description: Reference to the controller member to expose.

description.full:
Expose in the component context a property or method
 defined in the controller.
description.summary:
Expose in the component context a property or method
 defined in the controller.

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

// loads 'path/to/component_name.css' by default
cp.loadCss();
// or loads the view's css with options
cp.loadCss({
    path: 'url/of/style/file.css',
    success: function() { ... },
    error: function(err) { ... },
    then: function() { ... }
});

description.full:
Load the `.css` file and replace the component's view style.
If no `options.path` is specified, it will try to load
the file with the same base-name as the `componentId`.
description.summary:
Load the `.css` file and replace the component's view style.
If no `options.path` is specified, it will try to load
the file with the same base-name as the `componentId`.

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

// loads 'path/to/component_name.html' by default
cp.loadHtml();
// or loads the view's html with options
cp.loadHtml({
    path: 'url/of/view/file.html',
    success: function() { ... },
    error: function(err) { ... },
    then: function() { ... }
});

description.full:
Load the `.html` file and replace the component's view markup.
If no `options.path` is specified, it will try to load the
file with the same base-name as the `componentId`.
description.summary:
Load the `.html` file and replace the component's view markup.
If no `options.path` is specified, it will try to load the
file with the same base-name as the `componentId`.

description.full: this member is "attacched" from Zuix.js on controller initialization
description.summary: this member is "attacched" from Zuix.js on controller initialization

code: ContextController.prototype.log = {};

tags.string:
**Example - JavaScript** 

// Controller of component 'path/to/component_name'
var ctrl = zuix.controller(function(cp) {
    // `cp` is the {ContextController}
    cp.create = function() { ... };
    cp.destroy = function() { ... }
}).for('path/to/component_name');

description.full: Register as default controller for the given component type.
description.summary: Register as default controller for the given component type.

code:
ContextController.prototype.for = function (componentId) { return this; };

module.exports = ContextController;
